title: Steve Kerr proposes Russell Westbrook, Kevin Durant and Warriors 'sing a song' during All-Star Weekend
text:
February 13, 2017 3:54pm EST February 13, 2017 3:48pm EST Trying to break the ice, Warriors and West All-Star Coach Steve Kerr joked that Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook should "sing a song together." Steve Kerr. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 3:54 p.m. ET 
Updated at 3:54 p.m. ET 
Music is the universal language, so why not try to use it to heal a relationship with two people who aren't on speaking terms? 
That's what Warriors coach Steve Kerr jokingly posited he do as coach of the NBA Western Conference All-Stars, a team that will feature feuding superstars and former teammates in the Thunder's Russell Westbrook and Golden State's Kevin Durant. 
MORE: Kevin Durant, Russell Westbrook end up at same OKC restaurant after Saturday’s game 
"Maybe we'll sing a song," Kerr quipped, when asked about his plans for coaching Westbrook and four Warriors — Durant, Steph Curry, Klay Thompson and Draymond Green. 
Westbrook and Durant are allegedly not on speaking terms , and are coming off a Golden State demolition of Oklahoma City on Saturday. 
Despite the joke, it doesn't sound like Kerr thinks the two will sing kumbaya this weekend. 
"To be honest, I haven't read much about it so I don't know what they're saying to each other or at each other," Kerr said. "I think if anything, this might be a great opportunity to sit down and talk. But I don't know if that's necessarily going to happen [in New Orleans]." Watch This
